intro: Rhodamnia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined rhodamine, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Rhodamnia reticulata is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
